column4: I assume that you have a seperate / partiton for each release ?
do you have a specific issue ?
yes, well...after installing both 6.06 and 7.04 the system freezes when trying to boot...
Uncompressing Linux... Ok, booting the kernel   <--- it freezes here
you upgraded to 7.04 ?  try a clean install instead,
I did a clean install with both
The hard disk is wiped for each install
so I dont care whats on it
what are the system details ?  cpu ram etc
the problem maybe iwth the ati video card,  did you install with the live cd or the alternate install ,  actualy were you able to install at all ?
I don'T know then,  can you boot the recovery mode ?
then I don'T have a clue,  try looking up the computer model in the forum, maybe someone else had the same issue and figured out a fix
Am I right in thinking the alternative is Ubuntu 6.06 LTS?
no  the alternate cd says alternate,  there is one for each release for each architecture
